Job Title: Sales & Applications Engineer II

Location: Largo, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Position Overview: 

ONICON Flow & Energy Measurement has delivered market-leading flow and energy measurement products since 1987. We focus on delivering exceptional customer service and quality engineered flow and energy measurement instruments for hydronic heating and cooling systems. ONICON is part of the TASI Measurement brand of companies. TASI Measurement is a collection of world-class flow meter companies around the globe, producing flow meters and flow measurement solutions for various industrial and scientific industries.

Promotion from Sales Engineer I to Sales Engineer II is based on the employee having demonstrated that they have acquired the skillset and successfully performed the duties of the Sales Engineer I position and are actively providing leadership and coaching to other team members. In addition, they have demonstrated the ability to actively improve the organization through suggestions to management and the completion of special projects assigned by management.

This is an "inside engineering sales & applications support" position where inbound phone calls and e-mails from customers, representatives, and consulting engineers are responded to in a cordial and technically sound manner. In addition, Sales Engineer II will initiate calls to customers to ask about technical issues with respect to orders, requests for quotations, and specifications. The ability to communicate well is of the highest importance in this position. The ability to multi-task in a fast-paced work environment is required in this position. This position also requires strong interpersonal relationship skills due to the level of interaction with people both inside and outside of the company.

Key Responsibilities

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Works cooperatively and constructively with our Customer Service Team, Regional and Territory Sales Managers, and Independent Sales Reps to meet annual sales goals and ensure customer satisfaction.Develops and maintains strong technical and applications expertise with all ONICON products.Develops and maintains expertise with ONICON's order entry system. Prepares quotations and responds to technical inquiries in a timely manner in response to customer requests. Supports our independent reps in these efforts also.Able to read and comprehend engineering specifications and drawings and suggest the appropriate ONICON products to quote and submit, including pointing out exceptions to the specification.Supports preparing submittal packages and special wiring & installation diagrams for customers as required.Provides technical support and assistance to our Customer Service group, especially on large or complex orders.Provides direct support for high-profile projects and technical service issues as required.Attends trade shows in a supporting role, along with a senior associate. Assists service department with technical troubleshooting and product returns as required.Provides feedback and assistance to the Product Management Team regarding the development of sales and technical documentation. Provides direction, guidance, and coaching to EITs, Engineer 1's, and Customer Service personnel.Able to work cooperatively with the Engineering and Product Management Department to create SDOs (special deviation orders) to meet special customer requests when approved by management.Participates in training seminars for customers and offsite engineering training sessions (lunch and learns). Works cooperatively and constructively with the Customer Service Team, Regional and Territory Sales Managers, and Independent Sales Reps to meet annual sales goals and ensure customer satisfaction.Perform any other duties or responsibilities as requested by the Supervisor or Manager.

Preferred Qualifications:

A four-year degree in an engineering discipline is preferred; a two-year technical degree and 4+ years of related experience may be considered.Strong computer skills required.Knowledge of the HVAC building automation industry is a plus

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
